title: Global defaming of any twitter user

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Private tweets can be used to keep any user's tweet secret from rest of twitter world. Once the user changes his setting from private tweets to public tweets, all his secret tweets become visible. This can become a major issue causing global distributed attacks

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Assume the attacker is targeting certain president XYZ for the next election
2. Attacker goes to settings and enable private tweet
3. Attacker find famous tweets from 10000+ celebrity profiles
4. Attacker replies on all those 10000+ celebrity profile tweets mentioning "XYZ is the worst candidate. See what he did <some video or something>"
5. None of the twitter user can see that reply from Attacker since it is a private tweet
6. Once the elections are really near, Attacker changes his setting from private to public tweet
7. Attacker reply comments are now visible in all those 10000+ celebrity profile famous tweets
8. This can cause mass defaming, before twitter could actually intervene and remove attacker

## Impact

This can be used to defame any famous celebrity on a mass level

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

While the behavior you describe is true, this is intentional and expected.  
From the "About public and protected Tweets" [documentation](https://help.twitter.com/en/safety-and-security/public-and-protected-tweets): 

>**When you protect your Tweets**:
Replies you send to an account that isn’t following you will not be seen by that account (because only your followers will see your Tweets).  
**What happens when I change my Tweets from protected to public?**
Unprotecting your Tweets will cause any previously protected Tweets to be made public.

As this is intentional behavior, we will not be making a change here at this time and will be closing this report.  Nevertheless, we do appreciate your efforts here and hope that you will continue to report security issues to us in the future.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security!

activities.message:
Not sure why a protected tweet allows you to post on a non following member tweet when it would be non visible to the user. I thought that if someone is turning to private tweets then he/she must not be allowed to tweet on someone who is not following him/her. 

Since, we are allowing anyone to post invisible messages to any other user which can be turned visible as per attacker wish then it might make the intial poc very much possible.

Requesting public disclosure.
